## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
#| include: FALSE
library(tidyverse)
library(kableExtra)

cdbk_1b <- openxlsx::read.xlsx("C:/Users/Clemens Lindner/Documents/github/bigot_and_tolerant_personalites/0_data/three_challenges_codebook.xlsx", sheet = 2) %>%
  mutate(variable = tolower(variable))
```

```{r}
#| echo: FALSE
#| output: TRUE
#| width: 100

cdbk_1b %>%
  filter(scale == "RWA") %>%
  select(german_item_original,english_item_translation, subscale) %>%
  mutate(subscale = str_to_title(str_replace_all(subscale,"_"," "))) %>%
  rename("Orginal Item" = "german_item_original",
         "English translation" = "english_item_translation",
         "Subscale" = "subscale") %>%
  kbl()

```

```{r}
#| echo: FALSE
#| output: TRUE

cdbk_1b %>%
  filter(scale == "SDO") %>%
  select(german_item_original,english_item_translation, coding) %>%
  mutate(coding = case_when(is.na(coding) ~ "pro-trait",
                            TRUE ~ "con-trait")) %>%
  rename("Orginal Item" = "german_item_original",
         "English translation" = "english_item_translation",
         "Coding" = "coding") %>%
  kbl()

```
